speaker: Narrator
line: Sunny dreamt of a jagged, lonesome mountain bathed in ghostly moonlight. Time reversed before his eyes: snow retreated, bones appeared, then a slave caravan moved backward down the slope.

speaker: Nightmare Spell System
line: [Aspirant! Welcome to the Nightmare Spell. Prepare for your First Trial…]

speaker: Narrator
line: A dull ache spread from Sunny’s bleeding feet. Shackles tore at his wrists, his thin tunic useless against the biting wind. Ahead, a broad-shouldered man walked steadily. Behind him, a shifty-eyed slave cursed under his breath.

speaker: Sunny
line: What kind of a situation is this?!
notes: Inner voice; may be processed slightly internal.

speaker: Narrator
line: Sunny tried to summon a status screen. Runes shimmered in the air, revealing his Aspect.

speaker: Sunny
line: What?! What the actual fuck?!

speaker: Narrator
line: Name: Sunless. Rank: Aspirant. Aspect: Temple Slave. Aspect description: A temple slave is a useless wretch, rare but powerless.

speaker: Sunny
line: No useless Aspects my ass!

speaker: Shifty Slave
line: Whore's bastard! Watch where you're going!

speaker: Shifty Slave
line: You little shit! I'm going to kill you!

speaker: Broad-Shouldered Slave
line: Why bother? The weakling will be dead by sunrise. The mountain will kill him… and us, too, just later.

speaker: Shifty Slave
line: Speak for yourself, fool! I'm planning to survive!

speaker: Gentle Slave
line: This mountain pass is usually warmer. We had bad luck. Also, I advise you against harming this boy.

speaker: Broad-Shouldered Slave
line: Why is that?

speaker: Gentle Slave
line: Look at his markings. He was born a slave. A temple slave. The Imperials destroyed the last temple of the Shadow God. That is how he ended up here.

speaker: Broad-Shouldered Slave
line: So what? Why fear a half-forgotten god? He couldn't save his own temples.

speaker: Gentle Slave
line: The Empire is guarded by the War God. We are not. Do you want to risk angering another god?

speaker: Narrator
line: A young soldier rode up on a white horse. Noble, dignified — and irritatingly pretty. His voice carried concern.

speaker: Young Soldier
line: What is going on here?

speaker: Gentle Slave
line: It's nothing, sir. We are tired and cold. Especially the young one. This journey is too hard for him.

speaker: Young Soldier
line: Bear with it a little more, child. We will stop soon. For now, here, drink some water.

speaker: Sunny
line: Child? Child?!

speaker: Narrator
line: Before Sunny could drink, a whip cracked. Pain lanced his back as an older soldier glared at the youth.

speaker: Older Soldier
line: What do you think you're doing?

speaker: Young Soldier
line: I was just giving this boy water.

speaker: Older Soldier
line: He'll get water at camp! These slaves are not your friends. They're not even people. Treat them like people and they'll imagine things.

speaker: Young Soldier
line: But—

speaker: Older Soldier
line: Shut your mouth, newbie. Next time it’ll be your back tasting my whip!

speaker: Narrator
line: Sunny watched the older soldier ride past with malice. Then he looked at the young soldier, head bowed.

speaker: Sunny
line: I don't know how, but I will watch you die first. And you, second.
